member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.OnApplicationButtonMouseDoubleClick(ActiproSoftware.Windows.CancelRoutedEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: A CancelRoutedEventArgs that contains the event data.
member.remarks:
This method has no default implementation. Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation.
Set the Cancel property of the event arguments to true to prevent the double-click from closing the parent Window.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsMinimized
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the ribbon is currently minimized.
member.value: true if the ribbon is currently minimized; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When minimized, the ribbon's groups are not visible until the end user clicks on a tab, at which point they display in a popup. This saves screen real estate.

member.value: true if menu items are added; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsRibbonWindowMaximized
member.summary: Gets whether the ribbon is in a that is currently maximized.
member.value: true if the ribbon is in a that is currently maximized; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsTabGroupVariantPreloadingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the ribbon will pre-load all group variants for all tabs when the ribbon is loaded, instead of when each tab is first clicked.
member.value: true if the ribbon will pre-load all group variants for all tabs when the ribbon is loaded; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Due to the advanced layout/resizing capabilities of , certain calculations must be performed to determine the size of each group variant. These calculations take a tiny amount of time. By setting this property to true, all calculations take place when the ribbon is first loaded. This slightly increases the startup time for the containing Window. If this property is false, the containing Window will start faster however the might be a slight lag the first time a is clicked.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsTitleBarAreaVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the title bar area that contains the QAT (when above the ribbon) and the contextual tag group headers is visible.
member.value: true if the title bar area is visible; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This property should only be set to false if the ribbon is not being hosted in a , you are not permitting the QAT to be located above the ribbon (see the property), and you are not using contextual tab groups.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon.IsWindowActive

member.value: true if the containing is active; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Some user interface elements of the ribbon update when the containing is active.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether Aero glass transparency effects are currently enabled.
member.value: true if Aero glass transparency effects are currently enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: This feature is only supported on Windows 7 and Vista systems where Aero composition is enabled. In all other configurations, Aero glass transparency effects will remain disabled.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow.IsRibbonVisibleWithBackstage
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to keep the ribbon visible when the Backstage is displayed.
member.value: true if the ribbon should remain visible when the Backstage is displayed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonWindow.IsTitleBarVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the title bar is visible, to be used when maximizing the window and hiding any contained .
member.value: true if the title bar is visible; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Normally, setting the property to None would hide a title bar. However, RibbonWindow is often forced to be in None style to achieve its custom UI. Therefore, set this property to false in cases where you maximize the RibbonWindow, hide any child and want to achieve an effect similar to normal windows when their style is None. This sort of functionality is useful when trying to mimic a "full-screen" mode temporarily.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.UI.ScreenTipService.AllowScreenTipsOnContextMenus
member.summary: Gets or sets whether screen tips are allowed to display on context menus.
member.value: true if screen tips are allowed to display on context menus; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If this property is set to false, no screen tips will appear on context menu items.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.UI.ScreenTipService.AllowScreenTipsOnInactiveWindows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether screen tips are allowed to display on inactive windows.
member.value: true if screen tips are allowed to display on inactive windows; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: If this property is set to false, no screen tips will appear when the containing window is inactive.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.Backstage.CanClose
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Backstage close button should be visible, and whether Esc can close Backstage.
member.value: true if the Backstage close button should be visible, and whether Esc can close Backstage; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This feature is useful for scenarios where there is no document open in the main window yet, and Backstage is open, allowing for an end user to select a new document or open a document. In this scenario, you don't want the end user to be able to close Backstage until they take some action.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.RibbonGalleryVariantBehavior
member.summary: Specifies how a expands and collapses based on the value of its property.
member.remarks: The is intended to be used directly as a child of a control. In this scenario, the parent automatically sets the property to the group's variant size, and therefore enables the behavior specified by this enumeration.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.RibbonGalleryVariantBehavior.Default
member.summary: The gallery renders as a when the of the is Small. Depending on the space available, the gallery shows between and columns when the of the is Medium Depending on the space available, the gallery starts showing columns and auto-increases the column count to the number of items in the gallery when the of the is Large This option provides the largest number of variants for child controls.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.RibbonGalleryVariantBehavior.NoCollapse
member.summary: Same as the Default behavior except that when the of the is Small, it will not collapse to a and will still render as if in a Medium variant with columns.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.RibbonGalleryVariantBehavior.NoAutoSize
member.summary: Same as the Default behavior except that when the of the is Large, the number of columns will not automatically increase to fill the space available.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.RibbonGalleryVariantBehavior.NoCollapseNoAutoSize
member.summary: Depending on the space available, the gallery will always show between and columns. It will not collapse to a when in a Small variant or auto-increase the number of columns to fill the space available when in a Large variant.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior
member.summary: Specifies how child controls of a are assigned a variant based on the current value of the panel's property.
member.remarks: The is intended to be used directly as a child of a control. In this scenario, the parent automatically sets the property to the group's variant size, and therefore enables the behavior specified by this enumeration.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.Default
member.summary: Child controls use a Large variant size when the of the is Large. They change to a Medium variant size when the of the is Medium. They change to a Small variant size when the of the is Small. This option provides the largest number of variants for child controls.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.LargeThenMediumWhenMedium
member.summary: Child controls use a Large variant size when the of the is Large. They change to a Medium variant size when the of the is Medium or Small.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.LargeThenMediumWhenSmall
member.summary: Child controls use a Large variant size when the of the is Large or Medium. They change to a Medium variant size when the of the is Small.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.LargeThenSmallWhenMedium
member.summary: Child controls use a Large variant size when the of the is Large. They change to a Small variant size when the of the is Medium or Small.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.LargeThenSmallWhenSmall
member.summary: Child controls use a Large variant size when the of the is Large or Medium. They change to a Small variant size when the of the is Small.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.MediumThenSmallWhenMedium
member.summary: Child controls use a Medium variant size when the of the is Large. They change to a Small variant size when the of the is Medium or Small.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.MediumThenSmallWhenSmall
member.summary: Child controls use a Medium variant size when the of the is Large or Medium. They change to a Small variant size when the of the is Small.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.AlwaysLarge
member.summary: Child controls always use a Large variant size no matter what the of the is. This option is the same as not using a to encapsulate the child controls.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.AlwaysMedium

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Controls.StackPanelItemVariantBehavior.AlwaysSmall

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Products.Ribbon.SR
member.summary: Provides access to the string resources of this assembly, also allowing for their customization.
member.remarks:
Call the method to return a resolved resource string. If a custom string has been set for a specified string resource name, it will be returned. Otherwise, the default string resource value is returned.
If any of the resource strings are customized via a call to , it is best to do so before any other classes in this assembly are referenced, such as in the application startup.
